name: Near-Death Experiences Trivia Quiz | General | 10 Questions

questions.text: Who wrote the classic 'Life After Life'?
questions.explanation:
Raymond Moody.

	The others have also written about death and near-death, but Dr. Moody started the ball rolling in modern times.

questions.text: Who wrote 'Heaven and Hell' about his own mystical experience?
questions.explanation:
Emanuel Swedenborg.

	Long before Moody's book.

questions.text: Which is NOT a common feature of the near-death experience?
options: A panoramic review of one's life
questions.explanation:
Judgment by a divine panel.

	Everyone emphasizes that there is no 'judgment' by others. It is a non-judgmental event, with the individual himself (or herself) doing whatever judging may occur.

questions.text: Dr. Melvin Morse works with a specific population of people who have had such experiences. Who are they?
questions.explanation:
Children.

	Presumably, children have had less time to be contaminated or brainwashed by cultural biases, expectations, etc.

questions.text: Morey Bernstein caused a sensation about half a century ago with this allegedly true tale of reincarnation.
questions.explanation:
'Search for Bridey Murphy'.

	'Before' was Jock Mahoney movie (fiction) from the 50s - not too bad. 'Proud' was a movie from the 70s (fiction) - also entertaining. 'Resurrection' was a movie with 'Ellen Burstyn - so-so. Bernstein claimed to have hypnotized a housewife back to a prior life several centuries ago in Ireland.

questions.text: Which famous author remembered prior lives under hypnotic age regression?
questions.explanation:
Taylor Caldwell.

	She wasn't happy. 'You mean ... I have to go through all this again?' seemed to be her attitude.

questions.text: What celebrity claimed that he would make contact from the 'afterworld', if possible to do so?
Which of these has been suggested as an explanation for the near-death experience?
options: A re-experiencing of the birth experience
A physical manifestation of a dying brain
A psychological defense mechanism against death
questions.explanation:
All of these.

	Who knows? Believe it - or not?

questions.text: Which of the following is true?
options: All people who experience near-death experiences experience the same events in the same sequence
Everyone who comes close to death has a near-death experience
All people who have near-death experiences find them to be positive
questions.explanation:
None of these.

	Many people come close, but fail to have the experience. Some have negative experiences - most unpleasant. Not everyone reports having all the 'elements', nor is there any set sequence of events.

questions.text: Which author did NOT write about his (or her) experience with 'the Light'?
questions.explanation:
Robert Monroe.

	Eade wrote a bestseller, as did Brinkley. Atwater has also written about 'the light'. Monroe, on the other hand, writes about out of body experiences that are totally unrelated to near-death experience. Strange, strange books.
